page.title: 07Miss Dean - Author.
page.content: Miss Dean first came to North Stifford because she became employed at the Thurrock Tecnical College.She came looking for a house ,in 1962.She bought 'Viola Cottage'for Â£4,500.Before it was a cottage it was a pub named 'The Bell'because of the church bells opposite.Then it was called 'The Oak'because of the Oak tree in her garden.Miss Dean wrote the book called the 'Stifford Saga' which told the history of North Stifford and the surrounding area.It started off with a competition for the Women's Institute,to see who could get their village on the map.She won first prize for the Mar Dyke Women's Institute.There was so much information to put in it that they made a book.They sold 1,400 copies.The Duke of Edinborough accepted a copy. Matthew Tucker and Vivienne Clark.
